intro: Lithocardium chamissonianum, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland scrub habitats. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lithocardium chamissonianum is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system to access moisture.
